rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral verbs ('reported', 'had been in contact') without high-potency framing.
No moderate verb paired with significant scale/impact.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports one human case in Texas but contains no explicit calming language or cues.
'Only one case' has a minimiser but lacks an explicit contrasting larger scale.
The segment states 'Only one case has been reported', which is a statement of quantity, not a negation.
Factual report of case details, not capability or preparedness.
'Only one case has been reported' reports a numerical metric (cases) using a standard verb ('reported').
